##Harvard phd student staying in the US: I am waiting for the announcement of the new crown test

Weixin Signal Wowjiemian

Function introduction, the interface news is China has the influence original financial and economic new media, only serves the independent thinking crowd

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Image: Twitter

REPORTER: An Jing

“

"The weather outside is so good it feels like a fake outbreak. "

”

“

"The weather outside is so good it feels like a fake outbreak. "

”

"My student told me privately that he had been tested for the virus and was waiting for the results. I have no symptoms yet and am being quarantined at home to see if I will be notified to get tested. "

He Xiaowei, a doctoral candidate at Harvard University, told interface news that he had been quarantined at home for six days. At Harvard, two students have been diagnosed with COVID-19 pneumonia. It's spring break at school.

He Xiaowei's son is under the age of, and his mother is helping to take care of the child in the United States. He had planned to take his mother on a spring break trip to New York to relax.

After the city was shut down, he Xiaowei used Wuhan as a case study for a course to discuss the "state of emergency" . It never occurred to him that what had been an academic case would be so close to his own life.

He Xiaowei first heard of COVID-19 before the Spring Festival.

At that time, some Chinese media in the United States called it "a new type of SARS, " and some articles said it was caused by eating bats. He Xiaowei just thought it was "incredible. ".

At the time, the domestic focus was entirely on the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump. The U.S. Senate began an impeachment trial in Donald Trump on January 16 and continued until February 5.

"Few people are concerned about China's epidemic. "

He Xiaowei has lived in the United States for many years. According to his observation, the mainstream media in the United States does not follow a cosmopolitan line and focuses mainly on domestic affairs in the United States. Only the media in other countries can see reports about the epidemic.

Although he knew about the Wuhan outbreak, he did not feel any tension and there was little discussion among his classmates and colleagues.

What impressed him most during this period was the return of a classmate to the United States before Wuhan was sealed off. Everyone showed concern for her, and various Chinese student organizations at Harvard began to organize donations.

After receiving the donation, the student organization shopped locally and purchased a large number of face masks, protective clothing and goggles. He Xiaowei also felt relieved when he saw photos of the donation box with the school's name on it arriving in Wuhan.

What really made him nervous was that, apart from Hubei, the epidemic began to spread and confirmed cases increased in Zhejiang. He Xiaowei has relatives in Zhejiang, heard that Hangzhou will also be closed, "I feel things are serious. ". Later, miss he Xiaowei's community was diagnosed, the community was closed.

"My daughter-in-law is in a hurry, so let me go to the drugstore and get some face masks. " He went to many pharmacies, only to see a reminder that face masks were being restocked; on Amazon, most face masks are not available until mid-march.

He Xiaowei's wife went to the drugstore every day to try their luck, has not been harvested, coupled with the United States at that time the local confirmed few cases, the two gave up to continue looking for masks.

On January 21, the first confirmed case in the United States was in the West Coast state of Washington. Since then, most of the new confirmed cases have been in the West Coast states of Washington and California.

Harvard University is located on the East Coast of Massachusetts. Although the first diagnosis in Massachusetts occurred on Feb. 1, most of the state's previous diagnoses were related to a staff meeting at a biotechnology company in Boston.

The evacuation of American nationals from the "Diamond Princess" also did not cause anxiety among American colleagues and friends of He Xiaowei, "The evacuees were placed on military bases, far away from us, with good food and drink, and psychologists, and we all felt that this was a good arrangement. ".

During this period, the university announced in an email that applications for research projects in China would be delayed. He planned to do a research project during his summer vacation. After receiving a notice from the school, he said, "I feel that the project is over. ".

For Ho, aside from his family at home, the only effect the outbreak had on his daily life was that the research project failed.

The turning point for locals, he recalls, came after a surge in confirmed cases in Italy.

"A lot of people are planning to go to Italy because everyone likes to go there and it's spring break, but suddenly schools and institutions have stopped the trip. "

By this time, there were already concerns about whether passengers returning to the United States from Italy had quarantined themselves. Meanwhile, a community of nursing homes in King County, wash. , suffered its first death on Feb. 29.

After the first death was reported, Ho received an e mail from the school saying it was closely monitoring the outbreak and urged people to wash their hands. Department of the door also appear disposable disinfectant, in and out of the people began to apply disinfectant on their hands.

He then went to a local supermarket and bought soap, two bags of rice, 10 bags of flour and two leg of lamb.

He was considering the large supermarket people often queue, the future to reduce the number of crowded places, but the supermarket to buy things in the local people are "as always calm. ".

Back home, he once again began to look for masks on Amazon, but the price has collectively doubled. Disposable Masks, which normally cost just 80 cents a pop, became $3, which took weeks to ship, with an additional shipping charge of about $20.

Once again, he gave up on the idea of buying masks in the United States.

"On the one hand, I think the population density is so small that it is actually possible to go without masks. On the other hand, I think it is reasonable that several hospitals have recently sent out requests for help, saying that medical supplies are in short supply and that people should not take up masks. "

Perhaps because he usually goes out without a mask, he Xiaowei has not been discriminated against and abused by the local people. But he has also seen reports of discrimination against Chinese wearing masks.

Although he does not consider masks a necessity, he sent them to the United States from his family in China, taking into account the family's age.

As for the US government's alleged slow response to the epidemic, he said, the US has always been a weak government with a tough people, and people don't expect the government to do anything. "So now more people are buying guns. ".

In February, the FBI system recorded 2.8 million background checks on gun buyers, up 36 percent from a year earlier and the biggest increase since 2016, according to Forbes.

In hard-hit areas such as Washington State, California and New York, there have also been queues for guns, with sales at some gun stores up sixfold in the past two weeks. From Feb. 23 to March 4, payments made through ammo.com  , a website that sells ammunition, rose 68 percent from the previous 11 days.

February 23 comes at a time when Italy has declared a quarantine on 11 towns in the north that have been severely affected by the outbreak.

As the epidemic spread across the United States, the number of confirmed cases in Massachusetts rose to 218 as of March 17.

Harvard University issued a notice on the 10th, asking all students not to return to campus after spring break. After spring break, undergraduate and graduate courses will be taught remotely or online. The school was scheduled to start on March 23.

On the same day, Harvard University also required students to live on campus before the 15th to move out of the school, the school will be sent to preserve the baggage allowance.

Although the school began to take action, but he Xiaowei just recently with colleagues dinner, "everyone is ordered together to share. ". Recently, he noticed a change: The apartment downstairs was filled with online delivery bags, "eyeballing the most diapers and toilet paper. ".

As more Chinese have chosen to return home to escape the epidemic, he has received information from friends about airfares that have risen to about 30,000 yuan from Boston.

But he did not consider returning home.

In his view, to overcrowded, no quarantine testing of the airport, infection of the virus more likely, "the airport walk around, 100 percent sick. ".

Last week, he received an email from the school announcing that two of the students had been diagnosed. In order to protect personal privacy, the school did not disclose the details of the confirmed students. Close contacts will be individually notified to conduct isolation tests.

One of Ho's students privately sent a message telling him that he had been tested for the virus and was waiting for the results. Before that, he was in a classroom with 15 people, including the student.

After receiving the message, he began self-isolation, "can only wait to see whether will be notified to test. ".

According to the procedure, if he Xiaowei suspects he has a new coronavirus, he Xiaowei needs to call his family doctor first to determine whether he needs further testing. If the level of suspicion is high, the university hospital will send an ambulance to take him to the isolation point for testing.

With no symptoms at the moment, he chose to stay at home. At home, he mostly corrects students'homework, holds video conferences, watches movies and scours videos.

But the frequent stock market meltdowns and news that the outbreak is heading in the right direction in the video are a constant reminder to Ho that the virus is real and he is being quarantined.

"It's a good thing we have food in the house, " he said. "What worries me most now is getting a notice to have it tested. "

He Xiaowei's mother is not in a good mood and is worried about his health. His biggest worry is that if he were infected and passed on to his family, "life would be upside down. ".

When the epidemic ended, what he most wanted to do was: "Send my mother home. "

(he was given a pseudonym to protect his privacy at the request of the interviewee.)
